meanings.definition: a person who has a particular regard for someone or something
meanings.sent1: My little sister is an admirer of butterflies, always watching them with wonder.
meanings.sent2: She is an admirer of classic literature, often seen reading Jane Austen novels.
meanings.sent3: As an admirer of ice cream, he couldn't resist trying every flavor at the shop.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like an admirer's when she talked about her favorite singer.
meanings.sent5: The young artist painted with the passion of an admirer, capturing every detail with care.

meanings.definition: a person who admires someone or something, especially for their beauty or talent
meanings.sent1: The little girl was an admirer of the ballerina, dreaming of dancing like her one day.
meanings.sent2: He became an admirer of the famous actor after watching all his movies.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail, an admirer of the delicious treat in its owner's hand.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in colors that even the most devoted admirer had never seen before.
meanings.sent5: She gazed at the painting with the eyes of an admirer, appreciating every brushstroke.
